website_summaries.verdict: This budget-friendly portable baby monitor is easy to use and will continue to perform for an extended period of time.
pros: Includes a 5-level sound indicator that enables you to track the noise level when the monitor is muted
Boasts a 2-way talk-back intercom for added convenience
Comes with rechargeable batteries that keep the monitor running for up to 18 hours during a single use
Features a handy belt clip so you can go hands-free with your monitor
cons: Tends to disconnect and reconnect on its own

customer_reviews.title: Comes with power cords for both units
customer_reviews.text: I just recieved this and 2 seperate power cords that I ordered since they said "frequently bought together". I couldn't find anything in the description that said this came with power cords. It says rechargeable battery for power source, so assumed it didn't have cords. I'll be returning the extra cords & hopefully this review will save someone else from making the mistake I did.
customer_reviews.author: jess

customer_reviews.title: “Went silent” in the middle of the night. Spend a little more to assure quality.
customer_reviews.text: Any monitor that decides to STOP WORKING in the middle of the night while you’re asleep is horrible in my book. Woke up to my 3 year old crying next to my bed saying she has been screaming for me. Did I mention I live in a two story house and my daughters bedroom Is upstairs and ours is down?? We have a baby gate also that she’s smart enough to open (but generally knows not to.) I grab the monitor and it says linked, max volume but there’s zero noise coming from it. Let me just say I’m lucky my daughter didn’t tumble down the stairs. I DO NOT RECOMMEND.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Beware! These units require power AC connection all the time (NOT WIRELESS)
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed , really !!! Almost nowhere in a whole listing not mentioned that Child unit should be constantly connected to a power cable , while the Parent unit holds only 3 hours when fully charged (that mean the parent unit should be also always connected to a power cable). Really ? In 2017 i should deal with 2 cables all the time ???? If it was shown anywhere on a listing that you always should use cable for this to work , no one would buy it (or at least much less people) Bottom line , really disappointed in this !!! Will have to buy another WIRELESS one
customer_reviews.author: StephB

customer_reviews.title: I like the talk feature
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't interfere with my two other Graco monitors which is the most important thing to me. I like the talk feature, I can find out what my daughter needs before going upstairs or I can tell her just to go back to bed lol. However, the battery really does not hold a charge. After being unplugged for a few minutes, the battery is already dying. So if you are using this as a stationary unit, I would recommend it for the price. But if you need a unit that can be unplugged and move around the house with you, keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best audio monitor out there!
customer_reviews.text: Since my son decided to throw his baby monitor in the toilet, I had to repurchase these again. I am so glad I did because they've definitely made a BIG change since I bought these 3 years ago. The battery lasts SO MUCH LONGER NOW! Before, I could only get 4-5 hours on a single charge, but now these last more than 8 hours! Very easy to use and to set up. I like these monitors a lot because they are so sensitive to sound, you can hear everything!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Osborne

customer_reviews.title: It does the job but leave some things to be desired
customer_reviews.text: There is more quality than cost. It sounds good and the range is good. I wold love a green power light so i don't have to try to look at the dim lcd display to see it is on an linked. Also, a cradle to recharge the parent unit. Why? because the cable wants the slide off the nightstand when I unplug it. Also, you don't appreciate the number of things that can be done with one hand until you have to carry a baby around everywhere. I dare you to try to plug that recharging cable into the rounded parent unit with one hand. You can't. The recharging cradle wins again.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Grotticelli

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for elder care
customer_reviews.text: I am shocked at the sound quality. I actually have two sets......one in the bedroom and one in the adjoining bathroom. Both the “parent” receivers are in my room at the other end of the house. These monitors are for my 92 yr old dad.....I’m his caregiver. I can hear when he gets up at night and he can call for me if he needs help. Gives me some piece of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Audio quality is not great.
customer_reviews.text: Most everything on these units are exactly what we need from them, but the white noise canceling feature cancels out the baby a lot too. We will regularly hear our baby down the hall give out a little cry, but then not hear it from the receiver sitting right next to us.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Just Buy it Already
customer_reviews.text: I bought this baby monitor before moving our 6 month old out of our bedroom. Having it now for a couple weeks I have some opinions, good and bad. 1. I love how portable it is. I can prune apple trees in my back yard and it still stays connected. 2. It’s not a video monitor which freak me out post paranormal activity. 3. There seems to be a static interference every couple of minutes while it’s plugged in. 4. Works great as a pretend fast food drive up speaker. Overall I love this monitor and would repurchase again, but hopefully I won’t have to. It is simple and does the job. Peace to you and your little ones.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Jandro

customer_reviews.title: Best monitor thus far
customer_reviews.text: I love this!! I can turn the nightlight on from the master monitor. I can also talk to her by holding down the talk button like a walkie talkie. The connection is great and the sound is crystal clear. You can also put an option for vibration or sound alarm if the baby wakes up. Of all the monitors I have purchased throughout having kids. This by far is my favorite!!!!! Is also has a rechargeable battery, so if the lights go off. The monitor will still work.
customer_reviews.author: Simply me

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the money
customer_reviews.text: Decent monitor used for elderly patient easy to set up . The battery case cover is very flimsy and slides off, have dropped it a couple times now and the cover keeps falling off, not much room where I have to keep it so it has the tendency to fall, over all decent quality has lots of features for new or expecting patents, and the belt clips are convenient for easy carrying.
customer_reviews.author: Tom.V

customer_reviews.title: Perfect intercom system during Covid-19
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use at our office after having to lock the door during the height of the Covid-19 quarantine. The two-way feature was a must, as we needed to be able to communicate with our customers on the other side of the door. We put the parent unit at the reception desk, with the baby monitor attached to the wall just outside the front door. When customers would come up, we could hear them with no effort on their part, and could talk back to them with a simple push of the walkie-talkie "talk" button on the side of the parent unit. It worked perfectly! A cheap solution to a problem we never expected to face.
customer_reviews.author: Adam R. OQuinn

customer_reviews.title: A great resource!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to use for the quarantine room when we had a sick family member. Was a terrific relief, we could hear him constantly and used the intercom mode to communicate. Felt much more comfortable when able to stay in touch.
customer_reviews.author: China

customer_reviews.title: Battery dies almost right away
customer_reviews.text: I want to like it but the battery is always dead no matter how much we charge it. The range is great and the sound is good just need to have both units plugged in at all times even though the parent unit has a "rechargeable battery". We returned the original set because of this problem and the replacement set has the same issue. Pretty frustrating. We have family with a slightly older version of this and they have no issues with this.
customer_reviews.author: Darin

customer_reviews.title: Not if you use white noise in baby room
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work for us. We use a sound machine in baby room. I guess monitor was trying to block the white noise. If it had been able to block it completely or if it didn’t try to block it at all, I think it would have been fine. As it was, we would hear the white noise for a minute, then silence, then white noise, then silence. We woke up every time it changed. All night long.
customer_reviews.author: Julie H.

customer_reviews.title: an inexpensive monitor
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an inexpensive monitor--not for a baby--but for my new puppy who sleeps downstairs and I want to sleep upstairs and still hear her when she whines and needs to alert me that she needs to get out of her crate. It meets my needs. Fortunately the distance works for me and it is loud enough for me to hear her. I keep both parts plugged in all the time so don't have to deal with the battery running out and I haven't used the talking feature because I don't need that with a dog, but for a simple monitor it works well.
customer_reviews.author: GG.Sib

customer_reviews.title: Through rain or shine... or even snow.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this monitor about a year ago because we were having a problem with animals attacking our chickens at night. I put the monitor between the screen and window facing out and the handset next to my bed. Works great! You would be surprised what you hear at night. This has been in the window (generally outside) rain and shine, freezing cold and heat... still going strong after more than a year. Frankly I am amazed. Worth every cent.
customer_reviews.author: Samsonya

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a few months
customer_reviews.text: Beware! The audio and/or connection stopped working after a few months. Kind of shocking since I did my homework and this audio monitor was so highly rated. Thankfully, it stopped working just a couple weeks shy of the 3 month return window, and I kept the original packaging. If you do attempt to give this monitor a try, I suggest you do the same just in case. Also, the sound quality was pretty annoying, sounded like a bad loop. But you can have it on a low level and still hear you little one clearly. Too bad it didn’t last longer... seems like no matter what monitor you purchase, you’re taking a chance.
customer_reviews.author: Harriett

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Don't usually provide reviews and my experience may be different than others but this stopped working. I can't hear my child even though it says it's linked. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: These serve their purpose and work well enough for what our family needed. I give this 4 stars because I dislike that the unit which stays with baby can’t be taken off the charger or it powers off immediately. I don’t know if that’s a product feature or defect. I don’t plan on returning it though. Overall, good value
customer_reviews.author: Keshia_518

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and fits the need
customer_reviews.text: I have an elderly mom who sleeps on main floor, while I sleep upstairs. She is having health issues and due to her frailty cannot call me if she needs me, so I wanted a cheap device to use at night. It works perfect -- love the fact that I can talk back to her -- walky-talky feature. The buttons are hard to press and you have to hold them in and I cannot figure out how to turn off the voice message that plays every time I turn on the "parent" device but otherwise I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ddz

customer_reviews.title: Good in the beginning
customer_reviews.text: Loved this baby monitor compared to our old outdated monitor.... at first. It was crystal clear, the range was good, the talk back functionality was great, BUT after 6 months it's starting to give more and more static, and scratchy. Our old monitor lasted 6 years, for this one to start acting up after 6 months I'm assuming this won't won't last more than A year, 2 at the very most.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Elderly monitoring
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for my 80 year old mom, who has moderate mobility issues and falls frequently. The range is great, I can hear her anywhere in my house or yard. I even walked to the neighbors 3 houses away and could hear her. The two way talk feature is fantastic. She was able to call for me, ask questions, or request items and I could answer or get them without needing to run up and down the stairs. It makes her feel less afraid when she gets confused and thinks she is alone. I can easily hold a conversation with her while making her lunch or flipping laundry.
customer_reviews.author: Danée

customer_reviews.title: Works great for normal use and the battery life is rather strong. Check the video for range details.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to say this is the best baby monitor we have owned. This is our 4th kid and we were tired of using Sony's brand since it constantly loses connection. So I tested the distance and this thing can easily go hundreds of feet if you have no buildings in the way. This is perfect for anywhere in your yard and with the perk of talking to your baby and letting them know you're on your way is truly a lifesaver.
customer_reviews.author: Vampire D

customer_reviews.title: Great product & great price!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to track on my elderly mother in case she needs help at night. Was hesitant to buy because it had to reach through three floors. I’m in the basement & she’s upstairs from the main floor. It’s great & the sound is good! We love that it doesn’t take up too much space on our nightstands. I especially love that I can talk to her without going up three flights os stairs. This product is well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 90 year old mom, so I can hear her during the night, and she has learned that it will wake me up so she depends on it to get me in the room for whatever she needs. The screen is pretty useless but I don't really need that anyway, the nightlight is hardly worth talking about, I have no idea about the battery life as I don't need to carry it around with me so it's not installed, but the sound quality is excellent, I can hear everything that I don't even need to hear, even on the lowest volume setting, so it performs as expected and does the job for a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I love this baby monitor! I had a couple different types of video monitors but they all had static background noise. But this monitor only turns on the sound when baby wakes up and starts to make noise so it's perfect! And the sounds quality is amazing! Very happy with this purchase. I figured I really didn't need a video monitor since when I hear baby, I'd go in the room anyways. Perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Casanas

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend it because...
customer_reviews.text: VTech DM221 Audio Baby Monitor does have long-range listening and talking attributes. I use it to monitor a handicapped adult and can hear her quiet voice easily even outside. It sets me free to do even outside work, hear her even with her background TV volume up. Outside I can hear her quietly say "hello, hello". VTech understates the battery capacity. I clip on and carry the monitor all day without worry and plug it in next to me at night. It has a long charging cord. There are other good features. It is of rugged build and easily survives falls to concrete. I rarely review products but felt compelled with this one. David.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great baby monitor. We use it for my mom who is bedridden and it really gives me me piece of mind when I am in other rooms of the house. My favorite feature is - it will go silent when there is no movement detected so you don’t have to listen to background noise like a tv all day. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie M

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: My mother uses for my 100 year old grandmother. They both love this model. Great feature to be able to talk through it to my grandma. Only one way but is great
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M

customer_reviews.title: The VTech DM 221 is invaluable when you are monitoring a room.
customer_reviews.text: I have a brother-in-law who has stage four cancer. My wife and I can clearly hear when he calls out or is in pain. I highly recommend this product to anyone that needs to monitor a room where someone is need of assistance.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Randomly unlinks and sounds alarm
customer_reviews.text: Prepare to get alerted that the device closest to your child has been unlinked (as if it’s been unplugged) and that will sound your parent units alarm. It’s terrifying. The first few times I woke my husband up thinking someone was in the house and unplugged it so we couldn’t hear what was happening upstairs. Not something I want any other parent to experience. This is a faulty set for sure. I had this before and it worked perfect for 5 years until my child cut the cords off. I ordered a new one and this is it. It works fine other than the random unlinking, which also ONLY happen in the middle of the night. Be ready for that.
customer_reviews.author: NW fitmom

customer_reviews.title: Great baby monitor, Works with 220V!
customer_reviews.text: Great baby monitor, Works with 220V! Despite the responses here in multiple questions, and the fact that the chargers say 110-130, I took the risk and connected them on my 220V network. Works like a charm. This is not the first time I see this in appliances. They print 110-130 as they are tested/certified/approved/etc. for 110-130 only, but in fact in terms of electronics - most manufacturers don't bother using separate production lines. Unless it's a proper high-power appliance, almost everything today is 110-240V. Other than the 220V issue - it works well as expected :)
customer_reviews.author: O. M.

customer_reviews.title: very reliable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We originally got one of those wifi camera baby monitors but we always encounter issues with wifi connectivity and loading the video. So we got this as a back up and to use for weekend trips and now this is our main baby monitor. It's super reliable, with very clear sound and can be set up anywhere with no wifi needed. I've even run out to the mailbox (more thann1000 ft away) and was still able to hear clearly. So this gets 2 thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Mellos

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a inexpensive similar baby monitor when our first was born 5 years ago. Fast forward to today and we have 3, 5 and under. We keep our older unit in the room with our 3 year old so we can hear if they wake up at night and now that we have more kids we needed to be a little more mobile. This unit is extremely portable with long lasting battery. It recharges fairly quickly and has a nice belt clip so you can hear what's happening with your kiddos and be moving throughout the house, or even in the yard if needed as it has good range as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cosmo

customer_reviews.title: Using for Elderly parent
customer_reviews.text: I know this is a baby monitor but I am using it for my 90 year old Dad who lives with us. I ahve it set up in his room and the main transmitter in our bedroom. I have it set on low and use the vibe signal. I dont need to ehar him at every turn. I just need to ehar him if he needs me. Works like a charm and gives both of us peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Assistance to Caregivers!
customer_reviews.text: I believe this monitor was originally designed to help with keeping babies safe, but there is another very important use for this product. As the caregiver of a loved one recently place on Hospice Care, this monitor has proved invaluable! I can leave the room where the patient is, and up to 1,000' can hear everything that is going on, as well as know when the patient needs immediate assistance! We live on an acre of ground and we can communicate back-and-forth with perfect clarity! A wonderful blessing! I would highly recommend this item as a gift for any caregiver.
customer_reviews.author: NG

customer_reviews.title: also useful for elderly care
customer_reviews.text: I bought this several months ago and so far it's been about the most useful thing I've purchased off of amazon. I am a caretaker for my bedridden mother right now and whenever she needs me she knocks on the wall with her cane. I actually set up the monitor a floor up where she is and can still hear her knocks when I am working outside. I attach the receiver onto the bill of my baseball cap. The range is just fine on this big property...maybe about 200 feet in any direction from the house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best monitor
customer_reviews.text: We decided he didn’t want a camera or WiFi monitor for safety reasons and considering that we weren’t going to be far from him he didn’t think it was necessary we use this for sleeping and it’s amazing the battery life is the longest battery life I have ever seen on something it can stay over a day unplugged with us and we don’t have problems with it disconnecting the only thing I regret is not getting the set with 2 adult monitors because it would be easier to have one upstairs and downstairs to hear our baby
customer_reviews.author: Ruru

customer_reviews.title: Practically immortal
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a big reviewer on here, bit let me tell you guys, I've had this for almost 2 years continually working. Only just now am i having battery issues. This has been thrown, chewed on (baby and dog lol), and spilled on. Still going strong as long as the unit stays plugged into the wall. For the price on this, I would have expected to but another in a couple months, but no, it keeps on truck in. Would but another if this thing ever dies.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Kleen

customer_reviews.title: BEST MONITOR I HAVE EVER USED
customer_reviews.text: My mother went into heart failure and we needed something to be able to hear if she was in distress. This monitor is AMAZING The sound is crisp and clear The range is awesome The ability to talk to her through the device and let her know I was on my way to her was so helpful I could hear her snoring. I could hear her breathing. I could hear her moving in bed. The sensitivity can be adjusted. The volume can be adjusted. We call it the Mom monitor
customer_reviews.author: T. Arns

customer_reviews.title: Clear sound and great battery life
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one cause my daughters room is upstairs and on the opposite end of the house. Works great!!! My daughter is 2.5 and loves the night light on the handle, just bright enough to "scare the monsters away". She loves she can talk to me through it and I can talk back. When I am gone at night for work and my mom has her, I unplug it and it never dies, and it's in my moms room for about 10-12 hours without being plugged in. I would recommend this. Easy peasy set up.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Vician

customer_reviews.title: They have worked well for us!
customer_reviews.text: I was apprehensive on purchasing these because they are cheaper than other ones on the market but they have worked wonderfully for us. I haven’t really tested how long the battery will last I just charge it every night and it seems to work great in our one story house we have a large backyard and still picks everything up I also love that I can turn the sound off and it will just alert me when she is crying or yelling for me. Also she sleeps with some sort of sound or music and it has never interfered which is a plus! We have been using the baby monitor for over six months and still working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Harris

customer_reviews.title: Vibration feature amazing for people with hearing loss!
customer_reviews.text: I am very hard of hearing (almost completely deaf in one side and a lot of hearing loss on the other side). We had bought this as a secondary baby monitor set for when we would travel, but the vibration feature allowed me to not depend on my partner to wake up for the baby. There is not much for people with hearing loss unless you already use a Sonic alert system in your home made for deaf people, which we don't have. This has been a real game changer for us and I think the vibration feature should be promoted way more! Especially at such an affordable price!
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful sound quality
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality on these units in great. I use this to hear my mom when she tries to get out of bed without calling for assistance and the sound is clear without any feedback or background static. The previous units I was using had a constant static hum all the time...made it difficult to sleep but this unit has no background static but I can actually hear her breathing or reaching for her wheelchair. I didn't rate the battery life because I use this solely during the night and both units are plugged into the wall outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: My experience with this monitor is nothing but good. The range is large
customer_reviews.text: My experience with this monitor is nothing but good. The range is large, and I am even able to take it outside and up in my pasture. I can feed animals and still hear if my daughter wakes up. I live in a custom built redwood house, and the signal has to be strong to make it through our walls. I can leave her asleep in her crib upstairs and hear her anywhere. The battery lasts for hours, and the walkie talkie addition makes it easy to calm her down and even sing her back to sleep without going into the room. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kala

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the first 3 months as long as it was constantly connected to the plug. Then the sound quality started changing on the parental unit. It will get what I call a "sound surg" and then it will go back to the set volume you have it at, the sound surges happen randomly and often to the point it wakes you up. We have a white noise machine in the nursery so the sound increase are very noticeable and disruptive. It wakes me up frequently! ANNOYING!! Great product other than it has to be constantly plugged in and it will wake you up with its electrical issues... it's been trashed and a new monitor is on the way
customer_reviews.author: Charity M

customer_reviews.title: Great features.
customer_reviews.text: I do not have to yell up the stairs anymore. The talk feature works well for use as an intercom. Much better and more cost effective than an intercom.
customer_reviews.author: Lena M. Hicks

customer_reviews.title: These work great! Very cheap price for good quality.
customer_reviews.text: These work great for the price! You don't have to buy expensive monitors unless you want a camera, I definitely recommend this to everyone! It's cheap and works great! Our house is small so I just need to use it when we sleep because my daughters room is on the other side of the house, I always keep mine charged, so I never unplug it. Have taken it off the charger once tho, by the end of the day you'll need to plug it back into the charger!! The quality of the sounds is excellent, so is the screen view. If you want a baby monitor I definitely think you should get this one!
customer_reviews.author: Maysa

customer_reviews.title: a convenient tool for parents
customer_reviews.text: In addition to WiFi video baby monitor camera, we bought this sound only monitor. We found it's more useful than the video one, you can't look on screen all the time, but this sound only monitor can help you, the parent unit can go with to any place at home, depend on sound you hear from the parent unit, you can decide rush to the nursery, or look at the phone app screen from camera to see what's baby is doing, or do nothing.
customer_reviews.author: chatgros

customer_reviews.title: Annoying reminder.
customer_reviews.text: No problem with the monitor except that every time the parent unit is turned on an annoying message comes on telling you to keep it three feet away from the baby. Once the first time it is used would be fine but not every time I turn it on especially since I am using it to monitor my washer and dryer which are in the basement, not a baby. I have followed the directions given to remove this but they don't work. I plan to call the company when I have time.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Doe

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick for the cost
customer_reviews.text: This monitor does the trick and doesn't disappoint. Baby cries, you hear the baby. Nothing fancy. Sometimes, I do wish I had opted for something with video so that when it was quiet, I wouldn't have to open the door to the nursery to see if the kiddo was still breathing, but hey, monitors are just security theater anyway, so I guess doing the parenting thing isn't something to complain about. If you don't want to think too hard about this kind of stuff, just get this monitor. It will work fine. Go ahead and research, but you'll thank me if you skip it and save the time for a Netflix show. You're a new parent ... relax!
customer_reviews.author: Christy Oeur

customer_reviews.title: Missing cords
customer_reviews.text: I want to preface this review with we love this monitor! It’s the second time we’ve purchased as the first we gave to be used for my grandfather. That said, not all the cords came in the box making things a bit annoying. Our package was opened and we knew that ahead because it was used but it came certified from the warehouse missing pieces which isn’t very good.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Great simple baby monitor
customer_reviews.text: Great simple baby monitor. The parent unit cant hold a charge for several hours. My reason for giving it 4 stars is that the child unit must be plugged in to work. I find that very inconvenient when traveling. The clip on the parent unit does not work well either, but I was able to hook a small carabiner to the loop on the top of the unit to make due. Overall it works well for a simple baby monitor.
customer_reviews.author: IDesign

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful product
customer_reviews.text: The range is good. I don't use the battery feature. I like being able to test it by asking "Can you hear me?" I use it keep an "ear open" on my handicapped child while she swings on the patio and I am on the computer. It is helpful to be able to turn it down so I don't hear birds outside, but I can still hear her if she calls me or gets upset. It has reduced my stress a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: E Mast

customer_reviews.title: Quite useful.
customer_reviews.text: I am primary caregiver for my adult son who is quadriplegic. He cannot move around or use his hands independently, so needs to call out to me when he needs something. If I am outdoors, or in the basement, where I can't hear him, I have to keep checking in on him. With the monitor, he can simply talk to me, and I can speak back to him. He doesn't have to wait around for me and I don't have to stop in the middle of something of he has no need of me. Handy and increased safety.
customer_reviews.author: Mr & Mrs. Wickersham

customer_reviews.title: Very good audio monitor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Vtech monitor to replace an analog set that I had. The old analog set hummed loudly all the time and occasionally made ticking noises, and the sound quality was terrible. The new Vtech monitor is far better. It doesn't make any background noise and the sound quality is excellent. I had to turn them down because the default setting is very sensitive. For the price I highly recommend this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: dhetteen

customer_reviews.title: Good clarity
customer_reviews.text: The battery life lasts a long time. Our house is pretty huge and the range on this monitor is fantastic. I love the portable option for parents and love the walkie talkie option on the parenting device. No, I don’t use it to talk to baby but my husband when I delegate tasks for him to do in the bedroom from downstairs lol Very good product for its buck. Picks up baby sound well and very clearly
customer_reviews.author: KrisUCF

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. Especially for the price. I got the $20 yellow monitors by the same brand and these were 100x better. They came with rechargeable batteries and they last pretty long. I also like how it doesn’t play the white noise we have on in the room. I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Pangborn

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Even though this isn’t a very expensive baby monitor I was hoping for better. My son sleeps with a white noise machine on and I noticed that the sound cuts in and out. On my old baby monitor you can hear the white noise the whole time. This one it sounds like the sound goes up and down. Sometimes you can’t hear the noise at all. It’s very distracting and hard to sleep with. Honestly this was not worth the money at all. Skip this and go with something else!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Love this for an intercom also
customer_reviews.text: The size is wonderful and it works great as an intercom system. I wanted the one unit to stay open and the other unit optional. It took a bit to figure out exactly how to set it up, but if the "baby" unit is plugged in, it can stay open. The 'parent' unit can be turned off, and then on again as the need arises. It works great so for us. We use it as an intercom system when one of us is in taking a shower and the other is watching TV. Since we are in the 65-70 range, this seemed important in case of slip and falls.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Good product at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: I use this so that I am able to hear my husband when he is in the bedroom and I am in another room.He often needs assistance when he awakens from a nap and this gives him the opportunity to call me from anywhere in the house or outside in the yard. Works well for what I need. I can not speak to the battery life since we have only had t a couple of months so I do not now how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Great monitoring system for my handy capped wife!  Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: My 78 year old wife is handy capped and I have the transmitter monitor by her bed so I can hear when she need to be taken to the bathroom. I love the two way communication as I can tell her that I'm on the way. It has great battery like and range. I can even hear her when I'm outside in the yard! It also doesn't interfere with my wireless network like another monitor I purchased. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Literally a lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: This product has saved us much stress in our household. We placed one in my mother-in-law's bedroom, which is far from our master. She is elderly and sick, and now we are able to hear her if she needs assistance. It has been specifically very Beneficial on those nights when she is extremely confused, and at high risk for injuries or falls. We highly recommend this great product.
customer_reviews.author: Bikerred

customer_reviews.title: Great for backyard
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 kids ages 4 months-7 years and I needed something that would reach to the backyard. This is perfect and the sound quality is much better than I was expecting! We also have a Amazon camera in the room so if we hear the baby waking up on the monitor I can pull up the video on my phone to check if he’s really waking up or just moving around. This has worked so much better for us than a video monitor that doesn’t even work from one side of the house to the other
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn

customer_reviews.title: The best, no static sound monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Tried using our older video monitor from 2008 for our newborn. The static and hiss from either channel A or B kept is awake...not the baby! Bought this audio only baby monitor and are impressed with the hiss and buzz free audio. Also has nice "talk feature" to whisper something to the baby if he/she starts waking up. Didn't need to spend a ton either. This was extremely affordable and just what we wanted.
customer_reviews.author: G. Nassif

customer_reviews.title: Good Monitor for Noise
customer_reviews.text: Monitor does a good job at picking up noise of my children throughout the night. Although the battery life is not great, we did order another set when we had second child. We keep it hooked up to the charger throughout the entire night to make sure the battery does not run out and turns it off which keeps it working as we need it to. It does seem to go a fairly long distance as we have used it when walking around the house outside with our oldest daughter and youngest is inside sleeping (we never go too far though to really rest it).
customer_reviews.author: Brad L

customer_reviews.title: Clear good quality sound.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to listen to my dog in the backyard. The monitor picks up every little sound, dog barking, birds chirping, screen door opening and closing, air conditioner cycling off and on. Left the monitor on the back porch, and the "home" receiver on a table in the living room. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Barb M.

customer_reviews.title: Loud and Clear
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this after my 89 year old dad moved in with us. We don't have a big house but the guest bedroom where my dad sleeps is on the opposite side of the house from ours. This device works GREAT! I have had V Tech phones for like 20 years or more and I was hoping this monitor would be as good as my landline phones have been. Thank you V Tech and thank you Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mathes

customer_reviews.title: Not just for babies!  :-)
customer_reviews.text: We got this because my husband was bed-ridden for a few days, and he could reach me just by speaking in his normal voice. I had the "parent unit" in my office, or I would clip it to my waistband. I could go to him or just respond thru the unit. It worked perfectly while we needed it! Very impressed with the sound quality. Kept it plugged in most of the time, so battery was never tested for long.
customer_reviews.author: SueW

customer_reviews.title: Great produduct, I recommend these.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these when my mother was very ill. My stepdad was with her constantly these were able to give him the freedom to do things around the house while she slept. They both were crystal clear, they have great sensitivity & range. They were super simple to set up and use. The "parent" unit has a speaker & mic, which was great because she was able to ask for help and we were able to use the "parent unit" to tell her we were on our way up to her. Sadly, she didn't live long enough to create a better review. I would recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle CustomerTop Contributor: Crochet

customer_reviews.title: Love this monitor!
customer_reviews.text: We generally keep ours plugged in all the time so can't speak much for the battery life. The sound quality is fairly good. No interference at all. Not quite as loud as I'd prefer it to be, I do have some hearing loss so that is most likely just a personal issue for me, the vibration is certainly an added bonus with regard to that. Screen is clear, no difficulty and nightlight is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Sara L.

customer_reviews.title: Monitored my mother in law.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this monitor to "keep an ear on" my mother in law, who was dying. We were able to hear any change in her breathing or any distress she may have been in without actually having to sit in her room 24/7. Now that she has passed, I will be sending this along to my son, whose girlfriend just had twins. Would buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: HighPockets

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I’m the grandma so just wanted something inexpensive for my house. Battery life is great and sound is fine. I can hear her fine on it from downstairs. Only negative I have is when you’re in baby’s room and turn both units on - parent unit starts in loud voice talking to you So just wait til you’re away from baby to turn your unit on and you’re fine.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Nordstrom

customer_reviews.title: Try something else.
customer_reviews.text: This would be a great baby monitor if it worked like it’s suppose to for longer than 7 months. Now it doesn’t want to stay charged even after being on the charger all night. It cuts off while being on the charger too. Heard my daughter screaming from the other room at 3 am and not from the baby monitor. Not a happy customer. Now I will try another brand of baby monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I give this 4 stars with 1 Star lost because of the strange intermittent fuzzy feedback noise. We actually own 2 of these units and they both do the same thing. Still can’t beat for the price. This product has an impressive range- works in the front yard
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Moved to a larger house with the baby’s room on the other side of those house. This was perfect. Don’t need video (considering I use this when I’m sleeping anyways) and this lets me know when she needs attention. It also has a vibration feature for the parents who are heavier sleepers (or just sleep deprived) and a lights feature which also goes off when she’s making noise. That’s great for when I can only see the monitor, not hear it. Overall this is a great product
customer_reviews.author: Drew Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Picks up sound very well!
customer_reviews.text: I’m using this to monitor my husband, who is bedridden downstairs in our guest room. The sound is great! The microphone is very good: the monitor doesn’t have to be right by him in order to pick up the sound either. There are five levels of volume, so you can tailor it to hear what you want. In my case, if I don’t want to hear the TV second-hand thru the monitor, I can turn it down & still hear my husband call. I’m glad I made this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: SWait

customer_reviews.title: Better than even expected
customer_reviews.text: I am really satisfied with this monitor. I was skeptical at first because it didn’t have the fancier video feature, but even with my baby being on a different floor of the house, this monitor works great. I can hear her every time she stirs. It’s been very reliable too. We’ve been using it for 2 months now and I’m happy with it. I feel much better putting my baby to sleep upstairs.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Battery doesn’t last
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple monitor, no bells and whistles, but it served us well for a good 6 months. The battery life was excellent until then, as it should be for a simple audio monitor. However, it went downhill from there. I was only getting 2 hours or less on a full charge. By the time it was a year old I was having to plug it in everywere or it would beep incessantly for an hour before dying. Now it’s 18 months old, and no longer beeps. I thought it was in this morning, and it died and shut off with no warning. By the time I realized and ran upstairs the baby was crying hysterically.
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: Great features!
customer_reviews.text: Great baby monitor! There are different volume settings that allow you to make it so there isn't constant feed, I have it on setting #4 which will start transmitting with crying or loud cooing. There is a "talk" button on parent receiver so you can talk to the baby unit. Only downside is the battery, wouldn't last over 12 hours. I ended up buying a replacement battery.
customer_reviews.author: outdoorsy4816

customer_reviews.title: Intermittently and randomly loses signal
customer_reviews.text: We've used this monitor for about 5 months now and, while it has great range when it's working (I can go into the basement of our apartment without losing signal), it intermittently and randomly will lose signal despite nothing changing as far as the positioning of the parent and child units. It beeps when it's not linked, which is one of the more infuriating reasons to wake up in the middle of the night when you're a sleep-deprived parent! Still gets 3 stars because, when it's working, the child unit has good sensitivity for picking up sounds and you can adjust this sensitivity if desired.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: We had these for our first two kids and it made it about 2.5 years of use. Came back and bought another set for our third. For first-time parents, I would probably recommend this and if you have the means stretch for one of the good home security cameras rather than the cheapo baby products - you'll get more use out of it after they're grown. This set works well but it happens that our nursery has the wireless connection for our house and I feel it does interfere with that at times.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrod D. Spring

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. The monitor produces a static sound that varies between quiet and very loud despite the volume setting not changing. So, it sounds like a constant white noise (which I could tolerate at a low volume) but every few seconds it gets really loud, then back to a low noise. Then repeat indefinitely. We had it in our bedroom and had to turn it off completely. There was no way to sleep with that thing randomly getting loud and blasting static noise all night long. I will be returning this garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great "two" way communication!
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these monitors and probably use them unconventionally. I love that I'm able to communicate with my older (young) children if they are out of my sight and hear my younger ones at night if they need me. 5 kids makes for a lot of refereeing, these help me keep the chaos to a minimum and prevent unnecessary arguing, more importantly I can hear them at night when their sick or when my youngest wakes.
customer_reviews.author: Traci Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Frequent dropped connections with the base unit
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed in the reliability of this product. As I sit here writing this review the monitor continuously beeps to inform me that it is no longer linked with the unit in my baby's room. While I appreciate being notified that there is no longer a connection between the two units, I do not like how often the connection is broken (at least 10+ times a day). I'm not sure how common this issue is, or if we just got a faulty product, but it is important to me to be able to monitor my baby at all times, and this product prevents that from happening.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sound quality and lasts for years.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sound quality. I have went through several other video monitors, 2 in 2 years to be exact, and this one is great. No need for video, and I will NEVER go back to those again. Had one like this for almost 20 years before it finally gave out. Have a disabled family member that we use it for, and it works very well plugged in or cordless.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Not just for babies.  A great solution for the elderly too.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my parents. My dad has Parkinson's and dementia and will sometimes run my poor mother ragged calling her from the next room only to need something simple or to forget why he called her at all. With this, she can listen to him in case he needs help and still get things done around the house or just take a break from her caregiver duties. The best part is that it requires NO INPUT from him! He can just talk normally and she can hear him. No buttons for him to push or remembering how to work it. It just sits there on his side table and works!
customer_reviews.author: BigOilMan

customer_reviews.title: Not fancy but effective
customer_reviews.text: I bought this low-tech baby monitor - didn't need a fancy video screen, etc. I'm using it as a bird feeder monitor. It's nice to see the birds outside my window in the winter, but wanted to find a way to HEAR them too. My cat was my inspiration to do this, but she is not so impressed. But I like it - nice to have the soothing sounds of birds inside the house. (I don't leave it out overnight or on SUPER sub-zero weather days). I can see that I will use this throughout the year for days that I can't have the windows open.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila J.

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor, affordable and perfect for what I need.
customer_reviews.text: We don’t need (or care to own) a video monitor, so this monitor has been perfect and a reliable way to hear baby when we’re busy around the house. I like that the parental unit has battery, and that we can adjust sensitivity level. I wish the baby unit also had battery, since electricity goes out around here. I also love that I can talk at a normal volume when Im with the baby and my older kids can hear me in the kitchen. “Stop bothering your brother” and the such. Lol.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Ajo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you hate yourself
customer_reviews.text: I'd give it one star but no one reads one star reviews. The battery is awful. NiCad out of 1997 that won't last through the night. Microphone doesn't pick up sounds evenly so there are audible artifacts that keep you awake thinking "is that the baby or this POS monitor". Proprietary charging cable so you have to move the cable around with the crappy receiver. The receiver beeps when the transmitter goes offline (non stop). Need I go on? Nightlight doesn't put out any light. Speaker on the receiver sounds like you're talking through a com box on a 75 yo submarine. This is an awful product.
customer_reviews.author: E. Ferree

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we wanted for our older toddler
customer_reviews.text: We'd gone through a couple of video monitors with our last child and didn't want to splurge for another one since she's now 3. We'd still like to be able to hear her at night though and our room is too far to hear her calling. This lower-priced monitor has filled our need perfectly. When we need to unplug it, the battery life and range is excellent. The sound is clear but there isn't that annoying white fuzzy noise to disturb our sleep. I like the 2-way option and the light option on the monitor in the baby's room is also a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: DrKaraAyers

customer_reviews.title: Two units in two different rooms work great!!
customer_reviews.text: I've used these monitors for 3 of my 4 kids now and I love them. The first set didn't last long but this second one is great. We added a second set (the monitor with one parent unity) so we can listen for our baby in one room and our toddler in the other. There is a hallway and each has a closed door, but they work when the door is open too. We bought them about 2 years apart. Seem to be same model and packaging. But they work!!! Never cross over or interference. Finally what we need. Was so simple :)
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Olson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: This baby monitor is worth the money we paid for it! It literally sounds as if the baby is in the room with us. I chose the audio baby monitor without the viewing option because if I could see as well as hear I would be up all night looking at the screen. This one allows me to get a little bit more sleep, and for that I am thankful. I don't have to worry that I wont hear the baby. The audio is really really good. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri Ann George

customer_reviews.title: Super handy!
customer_reviews.text: We got this as a way to listen to baby in her bassinet in our room. We have a video monitor for her room, but she's tiny so still is in with us. During the day for naps this is great, can carry it around all over the house and yard and here if she wakes. Love that it's so cheap compared to all the fancy monitors out there. Old tech doing exactly what we need and want it to! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: billye

customer_reviews.title: A great basic monitor!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in June and I love it! The battery life is great! I’ve accidentally left it on all night a couple of times and it still didn’t die.(my son still sleeps in our room so I don’t need to use at night. Just during naps. But can confirm it will last through the night) I was a little nervous to try is because people were saying how their just kept disconnecting. Mine has not disconnected even once. It is just a basic monitor but that is all I needed! The sound is great and clear as well
customer_reviews.author: Danielle b

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: Some of the reviews for this product were quite amusing. I'm no where near a technical genius BUT If I can set it up anyone can. People complain about all sorts of things. I followed the "instructions" and this unit works just fine. Plugging it in so the battery will charge is extremely helpful (eye roll) Yes, I being sarcastic. The unit does what it's suppose to do!
customer_reviews.author: Debra J. Guastella

customer_reviews.title: Evaluate it more closer. For use
customer_reviews.text: Bought it hoping a early warning will notify if my lady is struggling. The sound coming out of this is so low I have hold to my ear. First night. I come down she had pulled her oxygen tube out. It would have made a lot of noise. She almost died.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Ruff jr

customer_reviews.title: Great use in addition to my video monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is a great audio monitor. We have a video monitor which is good and can be seen on our phones or the separate tablet it came with. It has sound and an ok picture, but we still needed more because we aren’t just going to stare at our baby on our tablet. This fulfilled the need because the VTech monitor has an indicator that lights up and lets you know when the baby is crying—I found this helpful when I was working out with headphones in my gym room. I also loved the vibrate mode and the alert modes that help wake you up if the audio goes to a certain level—great for heavy sleepers.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: It quit working after one usage.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this monitor for about 2 months now. I used it once to try it out before having my daughter and it worked exactly how it was supposed to. I just tried to use it for the first time last week and the sound cuts out completely. When you adjust the volume, the sound will work for a few seconds and then cut out again. The battery is charged and having it plugged in has no effect. This monitor is useless now. I wouldn't recommend buying unless you purchase a warranty with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Ritz

product_meta.title: VTech DM221 Audio Baby Monitor with up to 1,000 ft of Range, Vibrating Sound-Alert, Talk Back Intercom & Night Light Loop
product_meta.description:
The VTech DM221 Digital Audio Monitor with DECT 6.0 digital technology provides crystal clear transmission, eliminating the annoying white noise you hear from analog monitors. The only sounds you hear are coming from your baby. Totally digital transmission eliminates background noise and prevents interference so you can rest assured the only sounds you—and only you—will hear are your baby's. Make sure the Baby Unit is turned on. Move the Parent Unit closer to the Baby Unit, but not closer than 1 meter / 3 feet. If you are using the Parent Unit in cordless mode, the battery may be low and requires recharging. A full charge takes 12 hours. Reset the system by disconnecting power from both units, waiting at least one minute, then reconnecting power. Allow time for the two units to link to each other. Nearby cordless phones or other electronic devices may be interfering with the baby monitor. Separate these devices as far apart as possible. When you turn the nightlight on, if no sound is detected for 15 minutes, the light will turn itself off.

BRAND STORY
By VTech
feature_bullets: CLEAR AUDIO AND LONG RANGE - DECT 6.0 technology provides clear audio transmission, eliminating annoying background noise while allowing you to move from room to room. Up to 1,000 feet of range lets you stay connected to your baby from another room

5-LEVEL SOUND INDICATOR AND 2-WAY TALK-BACK INTERCOM - LEDs on the parent unit indicate the level of sound in your baby's room so you can visually monitor the noise level. The built-in intercom on the parent unit lets you talk to your baby from any room
NIGHT LIGHT ON THE BABY UNIT - A soothing light on the baby unit gently illuminates a dark nursery. Both the parent unit(s) and baby unit allow you to turn on or off the nighlight on the baby unit

SOUND SENSITIVITY OF THE BABY UNIT - You can choose to hear sounds from the baby unit all the time, or to hear sounds that exceed a certain level. You can use the parent unit to adjust the microphone sensitivity of your baby unit

The parent unit runs on rechargeable Ni-MH battery or AC power. To continuously monitor your baby, make sure you use both battery and AC power at the same time. With the battery alone, the parent unit can cordlessly run for a short time only
